page.title: 09QUARRYING IN CUMBRIA
page.content: New Northern Quarries is operated by Tarmac Holdings Ltd.It is situated at the north of the Sandside industrial belt just east of the Kent Estuary.The quarry was started in 1900 and has an estimated life of another 17 years.The workforce varies between 25 and 30 people depending on the amount of work to be done.The rock is mainly used in road building and the main product is Tarmacadam.There is very little demand for any other uses.Tarmac Holdings Ltd have their own fleet of lorries but occasionly extra lorries are hired.The fixed machinery is run by electricity while mobile machinery is run by diesel.The rock is blasted from the quarry face and taken to the crushing plant by dumper trucks.The TarMAcadam is made at the quarry and up to British standards and is regularly tested to remain so.The company has
